snippet: The comments by David Azoulay, who is Orthodox, underscored tensions with American Jews, who largely belong to Conservative or Reform streams.
abstract: David Azoulay, Israel's strictly Orthodox minister of religious services, says he does not consider Reform Jews to be Jewish; comment inflames tensions between Israel's Orthodox Jewish political body and American Jews, who fall mostly among more liberal Conservative and Reform Jewish strains.
lead_paragraph: The comments by David Azoulay, who is Orthodox, underscored tensions with American Jews, who largely belong to Conservative or Reform streams.

headline.main: Israeli Minister Says Reform Jews Are Not Really Jewish
headline.print_headline: Israeli Minister Says Reform Jews Are Not Really Jewish
